item.title: No Fuss, NodeJS LTS installation on Raspbian Lite Jessie
item.description: Copy & Paste, trust me! $> sudo apt-get update $> sudo apt-get upgrade $> sudo apt-get -y install git $> curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.33.1/install.sh | bash $> source ~/.bashrc $> nvm install --lts as of this writing my NodeJS LTS version: v6.10.0 What’s The Fuss? Node Version Manager (nvm) gets installed, we’ll then use it to install whatever is the current NodeJS LTS - primarily behind the scenes, it will spear you from crap of load of these commands:
